page.title: 01Cava & The Barrel Of Butter
page.content: Cava is about 1.5 kilometre wide. It is covered with heather and peat. Only two people live on Cava, in separate homes. Two kilometres north east of Cava is the islet called the Barrel of Butter. So named because this was the rent paid for the right to catch seals of the island. The barrel containing seal oil which was known as butter. Two kilometres east of Cava is a "single point mooring". This is a remote loading point for oil terminals on flotta. The oil is piped out to the SPM. Between Cava and the barrel of butter there there are, underwater, several wrecks of the German navy scuttler in 1919, these are a great attraction for divers. Reputedly this is the best diving in europe.
